wikipedia_page.main: Deborah Margaret Lavin, FRSA (born 22 September 1939), is a South African academic and historian, resident in the United Kingdom for most of her career.

response: *  1939   – Deborah Lavin, South African-English historian and academic

Leo Amery was born in Gorakhpur, India, to an English father and a mother of Hungarian Jewish descent. His father was Charles Frederick Amery (1833–1901), of Lustleigh, Devon, an officer in the Indian Forestry Commission.Deborah Lavin, ‘Amery,  Leopold Charles Maurice Stennett  (1873–1955)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online edn, Jan 2011, accessed 2 June 2011. His mother Elisabeth Johanna Saphir (c. 1841–1908),Rubinstein, p. 177.For more accurate information of the life of Elisabeth Amery see Nebahat Avcioglu, 'Immigrant Narratives: The Ottoman Sultans' Portraits in Elisabeth Leitner’s Family Photo Album of 1862–1873', Muqarnas: An Annual on the Visual Culture of the Islamic World, Brill, Vol. 36 (October 2018), pp. 193–228. who was the sister of the orientalist Gottlieb Wilhelm Leitner,Elisabeth and Gottlieb's father Leopold Saphir died when they were young, and their mother married Johann Moritz Leitner. Rubinstein, p.177. had come to India from England, where her parents had settled and converted to Protestantism. In 1877 his mother moved back to England from India, and in 1885 she divorced Charles.
* Deborah Lavin, ‘Amery, Leopold Charles Maurice Stennett  (1873–1955)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online edn, January 2011, accessed 2 June 2011
